recipes.title: Masala Omelette
recipes.description: A spicy and savory Indian-style omelette made with eggs, onions, green chilies, and flavorful spices, perfect for a quick breakfast or a side dish.

steps.title: Mix Veggies and Spices
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine chopped onions, green chilies, garlic, and coriander leaves. Add salt, turmeric powder, chili powder, and pepper powder. Add chopped walnuts if using.
steps.tip: Mixing the spices with vegetables first ensures they are evenly distributed.

steps.title: Rest the Mixture
steps.description: Mix everything well and let it rest for about 5 minutes. This allows the flavors to meld and the vegetables to release some moisture.
steps.tip: Resting the mixture enhances the flavor of the final omelette.

steps.title: Whisk Eggs
steps.description: In a separate bowl, crack 6 eggs and whisk them thoroughly until they are well-beaten and frothy.
steps.tip: A well-whisked egg results in a light and fluffy omelette.

steps.title: Combine and Cook
steps.description: Pour the whisked eggs into the vegetable and spice mixture and mix well. Heat a pan with 1 tsp oil, pour a ladle of the mixture, and cook on medium flame until one side is done. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes until both sides are golden brown.
steps.tip: Cook on medium heat to ensure the omelette is cooked through without burning.

recipes.title: Spanish Omelette
recipes.description: A classic Spanish-style potato omelette (Tortilla de Patatas) featuring layers of tender fried potatoes and onions bound together with eggs for a hearty meal.

steps.title: Sauté Potatoes and Onions
steps.description: Peel and slice potatoes. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan and fry potatoes until golden and crispy. Add sliced onions and sauté for a few minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and chili flakes.
steps.tip: Slicing potatoes to a medium thickness ensures they cook through while staying intact.

steps.title: Prepare Egg Mixture
steps.description: In a bowl, whisk 4 eggs with salt and pepper. Add the sautéed potato and onion mixture into the eggs and mix well.
steps.tip: Mixing the hot potatoes into the eggs helps the flavors meld immediately.

steps.title: Rest the Mixture
steps.description: Let the combined mixture rest for about 15 minutes before cooking.
steps.tip: Resting allows the potatoes to soak up the egg, resulting in a more flavorful and cohesive omelette.

steps.title: Cook and Flip
steps.description: Heat 2 tsp oil in a small pan and pour the mixture. Cover and cook on medium flame for 5 minutes. Use a plate to flip the thick omelette and cook the other side for 5 more minutes.
steps.tip: Using a plate to flip is the easiest way to handle the weight of a thick Spanish omelette.
